snippet: In a legal battle between two oligarchs, a High Court judge in Britain rejected a $5.1 billion claim that became a window into the murky business culture of post-Soviet Russia.
abstract: Russian tycoon Boris Berezovsky loses multibillion-dollar lawsuit against his former friend Roman A Abramovich, a Kremlin favorite who owns London's Chelsea soccer club; Berezovsky accused Abramovich of acting in concert with Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin to bully and blackmail him into selling his shares in the Russian oil company Sibneft and other assets in 2001 for a fraction of their value, under threat that the Kremlin might expropriate his holdings.

byline.original: By JOHN F. BURNS and RAVI SOMAIYA

lead_paragraph: In a legal battle between two oligarchs, a High Court judge in Britain rejected a $5.1 billion claim that became a window into the murky business culture of post-Soviet Russia.

headline.seo: Russian Tycoon Loses Multibillion-Dollar Case Over Oil Fortune to Kremlin Favorite
headline.main: Russian Tycoon Loses Multibillion-Dollar Case Over Oil Fortune to Kremlin Favorite
headline.print_headline: Russian Tycoon Loses Multibillion-Dollar Case Over Oil Fortune to Kremlin Favorite
